questions.question: The airbag provides:

options.text: Rapid cushioning from vibrations due to unevenness on roads
Additional protection to occupants of a vehicle in the event of an impact
The possibility of relaxed driving, with the head resting on it.

questions.question: In which situation can a vehicle be immobilized?

options.text: When the driver is not carrying a driving license
When the technical condition of a vehicle damages public roads or affects the environment
When the driver is not carrying the registration certificate.

questions.question: If the car stalls in a tunnel:

options.text: Stop using the engine
The engine has to work, to use the hazard warning lights
Shut the doors and walk away.

questions.question: The light signals of a vehicle must:

options.text: Operate only at night
Correspond to the technical conditions imposed and approved (homologated) by the competent authority
Not to be used in urban areas.

questions.question: When are the hazard (blinking) lights used?

options.text: When driving in a row of vehicles at low speed
When the vehicle is moving very slowly, for objective reasons
When driving on slippery roads.

questions.question: In what situation is it prohibited to drive a vehicle on public roads?

options.text: When the noise, whether in motion or when stationary exceeds the legal limit allowed for that type of vehicle
When they do not follow rules regarding the transport of dangerous goods
When they have mounted warning sound devices other than those approved (homologated) by the competent authority.

questions.question: It is prohibited for vehicles to be equipped with:

options.text: Radar jamming devices
Navigation systems
Anti theft sound systems.

questions.question: Which vehicles must carry out their technical inspection before term?

options.text: Vehicles older than 10 years
Vehicles with braking and steering systems badly damaged
Vehicles with the Inscription SCHOOL.

questions.question: The most common malfunction of the engine cooling system is:

options.text: Weakening or breaking of the drive belt for the fan and water pump
Clogging of the air intake that feeds the fan
A slipping clutch.

questions.question: Afetr using antifreeze solutions over long periods of time, you should apply the following rules:

options.text: Always check the optimal fluid level in the expansion tank
After more than 3 years of usage the antifreeze solution should be replaced completely, even if it’s density meets the requirements
Check the color of the liquid in the expansion tank.

questions.question: How do you use the engine braking capacity optimally when driving on a long downhill slope?

options.text: Change into a higher gear
Change in time into a lower gear
After shifting, immediately engage the neutral gear.

questions.question: The Coolant temperature which ensures maximum performance and minimum engine wear is in the range:
On encountering technical failures of the steering mechanism, you should:

options.text: Ask people who have encountered such situations
Keep moving, because the fault is due to state of the public road
Address the problem immediately at specialized workshops with trained personnel.

questions.questionsNumber: 14 What does a RWD car (rear way drive) do if you accelerate aggressively on a curve?
questions.question: What does a RWD car (rear way drive) do if you accelerate aggressively on a curve?

options.text: The car follows the wheel without any deviation
The car tends to swerve back to the outside of the curve
The front wheels rotate quickly.

questions.question: How should you drive, to reduce pollution?

options.text: Start the engine pressing the acceleration pedal to a quarter of its full range and wait for it to heat up, to further reduce fuel consumption
Start the engine without pressing on the accelerator and immediately start
Press the acceleration pedal all the way, start the engine and drive speedily.

questions.question: When is it best to check tire pressure?

options.text: Always at 300 km
As a rule, before you hit the road
Only in winter, when the tires are cold.

questions.question: To which part of a road does a vehicle tend to skid, when performing a left turn at a high speed?

options.text: To the right, to the outside (the exterior) of a curve
To the inside of the curve, in the opposite direction
The vehicle does not skid in any situation.

questions.question: Driving long periods with a defective thermostat and a coolant temperature of less than 60 degrees C leads to:

options.text: Increased fuel consumption
Inability to warm the engine compartment cabin
Blocking of the water pump.

questions.question: Driving ability can be reduced after consuming a relatively small amount of alcohol?

options.text: Not if you consume a cup of coffee as well
Even small amounts of alcohol can reduce driving ability
No, small quantities do no harm.

questions.question: When a cyclist raises the right arm vertically, it indicates:

options.text: An intention to change direction to the right
An intention to stop
That motorists can overtake the cyclist.

questions.question: You intend to tow a car whose power steering motor has stopped functioning. What should you consider?

options.text: To block the direction of travel
The steering requires greater physical effort, so you have to tow very carefully
You are not allowed to tow it in this situation.

questions.question: How do you park a car using the gears, so that it does not move on a slope?

options.text: Use the regular service brake
Engage the gear into neutral
Engage into a lower gear lever and use the hand brake.

questions.question: Does tire pressure have an effect on fuel consumption?

options.text: Yes
No
Only on heavy vehicles.

questions.question: When you brake, you notice that you vehicle skids. How do you react correctly?

options.text: Brake to the maximum
Release the brake pedal and turn the steering wheel in the direction opposite to the skidding
Stop the engine.

questions.question: Black smoke emitted from an exhaust indicates:

options.text: Damage to the exhaust valves
An excessive consumption of fuel
An excessive consumption of oil.

questions.question: Motor vehicles are prohibited to travel on public roads when:

options.text: The registration certificate is damaged
They do not meet the technical conditions relating to road safety and environmental protection
The validity of the periodic technical inspection has expired.

questions.question: To drive on icy roads, it is recommended to equip the car with:

options.text: Snow chains
Special tires or snow chains
Sand and shovel.

questions.question: Under what circumstances can vehicles and trailers move on public roads?

options.text: When they look decent
When they do not exceed the weight and gauge specified in the certificate of incorporation
When they are in good condition and meet the technical requirements established by law.

questions.question: It is prohibited to circulate on public roads if:

options.text: The braking equipment is faulty
Gas emissions reach the legal limit allowed
You mount lighting and signaling devices other than those approved by the competent authority.

questions.question: The main cause for the explosion of tires while driving is:

options.text: Insufficient air
Too much air
Moderate wear.

questions.question: In which of these situations does the consumption of fuel increase?

options.text: When the engine does not reach its operating temperature
When the exhaust smoke is black
When the engine functions with interruptions.

questions.question: A vehicle is not allowed to travel on roads when:

options.text: One of the lights does not work
The windshield is cracked
Toxic gas from the vehicle is beyond the legally allowed limit.

questions.question: When you realize that you have vision problems, you should:

options.text: Buy spectacles with superior characteristics
Avoid driving until you consult the doctor, and follow his counsel
Drive using the high beam even in cities or when approaching other oncoming vehicles.

questions.question: What precautionary measures should you take when using antifreeze solution?

options.text: No measures, because the liquid is not harmful
Avoid contact with it, because it is toxic
Do not combine with water, because it emits too much heat.

questions.question: Fuel consumption increases if:

options.text: The coolant does not contain antifreeze
The steering is manual
Any device powered by the electric generator is used.

questions.question: The thermostat belongs to which category of installations:

options.text: Cooling
Lubrication
Fueling.

questions.question: Vehicles are prohibited to travel on public roads if:

options.text: The steering mechanism presents wear over the limits
The vehicle has inscriptions, designs, distinctive signs or advertisements likely to prevent or lessen the effectiveness of the vehicles lighting, or reading of the license plate numbers
The vehicle has accessories on the windshield or side windows that restrict or blur the vision of the driver.

questions.question: Causes that may increase the oil level in the oil bath/case are:

options.text: Frequently travelling on unpaved roads
Water or fuel leakage into the oil bath/case
Failure of the oil pump.

questions.question: The periodic technical inspection of vehicles and trailers must be made:

options.text: Annually, in any garage
Periodically, by law
Not later than two years, at a licensed inspection station.

questions.question: What are the criteria for assessing the effectiveness of brakes?

options.text: Braking distance
Shape of brake pedal
Size of braking marks imprinted on roads.

questions.question: For maintaining the lubrication system you must:

options.text: Check and replenish the oil bath
Replace the oil after the expiration date
Clean the radiator vent.

questions.question: You may travel on public roads with a damaged vehicle:

options.text: For a of maximum of 10 days from the date of event
Until the expiry of the compulsory insurance
For not more than 30 days from the date of damage.

questions.question: How should a driver proceed if technical problems make it impossible to continue the journey?

options.text: If it problems cannot be rectified, drive to the nearest service facility
Pull the vehicle off the roadway, till a service team reaches the vehicle
Ensure that the vehicle is protected against burglary and go in search of help.

questions.question: What types of collisions have the most destructive force?

options.text: Lateral collisions
Frontal collisions
Rear collisions.

questions.question: The criterion for choosing a gasoline type for spark ignition engines is:

options.text: Color and consistency
Octane (CO)
Figure Catania (DC)

questions.question: What do you check on a car attached to a trailer before you drive on public road?

options.text: That the water supply system of the trailer works
That rear visibility through the rearview mirrors is provided
That the persons travelling in the trailer are wearing seatbelts.

questions.question: What can be attached to a vehicle in category B?

options.text: A light trailer, whose weight does not exceed 750 kg
A trailer or semi-trailer with GVW (maximum weight) of up to 1 t
A trailer, which along with the category B car should not exceed 4250 kg.

questions.question: Motorists have the following obligations before starting on the road:

options.text: To check the lights and signaling system
To verify the installation of air conditioning
To always maintain a clean windshield.

questions.question: What happens when braking effectiveness is very different on the wheels of an axle?

options.text: It reduces speed
The vehicle stability is maintained
The vehicle could skid sideways.

questions.question: Vehicles must be inspected technically, even if the due date has not been exceeded:

options.text: If the vehicle had severe damage to the steering, as result of an accident
If the owner’s driving license was withdrawn for a period exceeding 12 months
If the registration certificate is lost.

questions.question: Hydroplaning is the apparent floating of a tire on a thin film of water. When does hydroplaning occur?

options.text: At high speed on a wet surface
Due to jerking movements in the driving direction
When doing left and right turns or in tight curves.

questions.question: Measuring pollutants from vehicles with petrol engine involves:

options.text: Checking the firmness of the exhaust system;
Determining the concentration of CO when idling the engine;
Determining the concentration of CO at an engine speed of at least 2000 revolutions/minute

questions.question: What is necessary and helpful to check before leaving on trip?

options.text: If there is enough fluid in the windshield washer reservoir;
If the light-signaling system properly works;
If tyre pressure is as per the technical book.

questions.question: What are the reasons due to which pollutant emissions occur in a motor vehicle?

options.text: Incomplete combustion of fuel
Imperfect sealing of fuel tank
Imperfect sealing of supply pipes.

questions.question: The authenticity of cars and trailers is certified by:

options.text: Road Police
Romanian Auto Register (RAR)
Romanian Road Authority.

questions.question: What is meant by maximum authorized mass?

options.text: Total mass of freight that can be transported
The weight of a vehicle
Total laden weight declared admissible by a competent authority.
